content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Search for a hotel in Hokkaido for the period March 1 to March 7, 2024, with a rating of 9+, check out its user reviews, which categories are greater than 9 and which are less than 9?  Please interact with https://www.booking.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The first step is to enter the destination "Hokkaido" in the "Where are you going?" textbox to begin the hotel search process.
Action: Type [14]; Hokkaido
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is currently showing September and October 2025. I need to select March 1 to March 7, 2024 as the check-in and check-out dates. To do this, I need to go back month by month on the calendar until I reach March 2024.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am still not at March 2024 yet; the calendar displays October and November 2025. I need to keep going to previous months. Clicking "Previous month" again will move closer to the desired dates.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.18
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar has returned to September and October 2025, but I need to reach March 2024. I should keep navigating to previous months until March 2024 is displayed.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is still showing the future (October and November 2025, same as before). I need to continue clicking "Previous month" until March 2024 is reached, so I will click the previous month button again.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.23
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is looping back to September and October 2025, which means the action didn't progress the calendar to earlier dates and may be in a loop. I need to look for a way to go further back or enable a quicker date selection; repeatedly pressing "Previous month" is not working as intended. Instead, I'll try to interact with the calendar opener to see if it offers a faster navigation to March 2024.
Action: Click [15]
Confidence: 0.8
Completion: 0.23
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar has closed, but the dates have not been set correctly to March 1-7, 2024. I should try to re-open the calendar and continue to navigate backwards to reach March 2024.
Action: Click [15]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.24
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is currently open, displaying September and October 2025, but I need to select March 2024. There are only "Next month" buttons (no "Previous month"), which possibly indicates I am stuck at this view, or I need to scroll or look for another way to select a much earlier date. Since there are no visible year selectors or a way to go to previous years, I should try scrolling down to see if more controls or options emerge for choosing earlier dates.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.7
Completion: 0.24
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Scrolling did not reveal any way to quickly navigate the calendar to earlier years or months, and the earliest visible dates remain in September/October 2025. There is an "Exact dates" button [14] which could provide an alternative way to directly input dates or select from a wider range, possibly allowing me to input March 1 to March 7, 2024.
Action: Click [14]
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Clicking "Exact dates" [14] did not open a new interface for entering dates; the page content remains largely the same, with no new date selection options. This suggests that "Exact dates" is not interactive in the way hoped, or another method is needed to select dates much further in the past. Given the current state, my next possible step is to try scrolling up to see if the top of the calendar or alternative controls (like a year switcher or more calendar options) are above.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.7
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar still only displays September and October 2025, and the only navigation present is "Next month" [18], with no option to go back to earlier years such as 2024. The "Check-in date — Check-out date" button [15] might potentially reset the calendar or offer another way to input the dates.
Action: Click [15]
Confidence: 0.8
Completion: 0.26
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Check-in date — Check-out date" button [15] has now reset the calendar/date selection UI, but the dates are still not specified. To proceed, I need to manually trigger the calendar datepicker again to see if this allows me to access earlier years for the selection of March 1-7, 2024.
Action: Click [15]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.27
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is again stuck displaying only September and October 2025, with no way to go back to previous years or select March 2024. All navigation options either advance to future months or, if selected, have already been tried. The workflow is stuck due to the inability to select the correct date range. At this point, the best course is to try refreshing the search interface by clicking the "Search" button [99] again and see if it reloads the calendar, possibly allowing earlier date selection.
Action: Click [99]
Confidence: 0.7
Completion: 0.28
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is still only permitting dates in September and October 2025, and there is no visible way to select dates prior to these months. There may be a technical or session-related issue that has locked the calendar into the future. Given that clicking "Exact dates" [89] is a calendar option that hasn't been fully explored, I should try that to see if it allows direct input for dates or offers a year selector.
Action: Click [89]
Confidence: 0.8
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: After clicking "Exact dates" [89], nothing new appeared, and the only visible month navigation still goes forward, not back to March 2024. All available navigation and input options for changing to the desired dates have been tried and the interface appears to be stuck. There may be another page refresh or session reset required, but all in-page controls have been exhausted.

Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.6
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results page is displayed. However, the only visible hotel listing ("Hotel Global View Hakodate") currently has a rating of 8.5, which does not meet the "9+" rating requirement. I need to filter results to only show hotels with a rating of 9 or above. There is a "Wonderful: 9+" filter [33] in the sidebar that should enable this.
Action: Click [33]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The filtered results now show a hotel ("Executive Suite SUIREI") with a rating of 9.7, which meets the requirement. The listing displays a location rating of 9.3. To get the breakdown of user reviews by categories and see which ones are greater than 9 and which are less than 9, I need to go to the hotel's detail page, likely by clicking the hotel name.
Action: Click [45]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.6
